questions.text: The most common cause of vesicovaginal fistula in India is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Obstructed labor

Highyeild:

Most common urinary fistula: Vesicovaginal. The most common cause of vesicovaginal in India: Obstructed labor. Most common cause of ureterovaginal fistula: Injury to the ureter after gynecological the operation, especially Wertheim’s hysterectomy. The most common cause of vesicouterine fistula: Cesarean section. The most common cause of vesicouterine fistula: Cesarean section. The most common cause of rectovaginal fistula: A cesarean perineal tear.

Extraedge:

Avoid intercourse for at least 3 months. Avoid pregnancy for at least 12 months.

questions.text: Kamla, a 48-year-old lady underwent a hysterectomy. On the seventh day, she developed a fever, burning micturition, and continuous urinary dribbling. She can also pass urine voluntarily. The diagnosis is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Uretero-vaginal fistula Continuous dribbling of urine following hysterectomy points towards urinary fistulas as the diagnosis.: If there is filling and emptying of the bladder along with the fistula, it suggests the fistula opening into one ureter i.e. ureterovaginal fistula. As far as urethral fistulae are concerned, they give little trouble because the urethra is normally empty of urine. However, during micturition urine passes through the fistula and may then fill the vagina to dribble during body movements for a short time afterward.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A: In the case of urinary fistulas, if the patient never needs to void as there is continuous dribbling it signifies that the fistula communicates with the bladder. Option B: In urge incontinence, the patient has the urge to void urine at a moment’s notice and she is unable to control her bladder and passes urine instantly. Option C :In stress incontinence, dribbling of urine occurs only when intra-abdominal pressure is raised.

questions.text: A patient presents post 2 weeks after having a total vaginal hysterectomy with anterior colporrhaphy and Burch procedure for uterine prolapse and stress urinary incontinence. She complains of a constant loss of urine throughout the day. She denies any urgency or dysuria. Which of the following is the most likely explanation for this complaint?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Vesicovaginal fistula Both vesicovaginal and ureterovaginal fistulas are complications that occur rarely after benign gynecologic procedures. 75% of fistulas occur after abdominal hysterectomies and 25% occur as a result of vaginal operations. Classically, urinary tract fistulas present with painless and continuous loss of urine 8 to 12 days after surgery.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A: Since this patient has no symptoms of stress incontinence, failure of the procedure would not be the correct answer. Options B and D : Urinary tract infections and bladder dyssynergia present with dysuria, urgency, and frequency.

questions.text: A 49-year-old female with a chief complaint of continuous dribbling of urine. She also says she can pass urine normally. She should best be treated by:

options.label: B
options.text: End-to-end anastomosis through a ureteric catheter

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Ureteroneocystostomy Surgeries for ureteric fistulae: Bladder lap procedure (Modified- Boari–Ocker–Bladd) Ureteroneocystostomy: Implantation into the bladder.

Highyeild:

Surgeries for ureteric fistulae: Bladder lap procedure (Modified- Boari–Ocker–Bladd) Ureteroneocystostomy: Implantation into the bladder.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option B: End-to-end anastomosis may lead to stricture formation. Option C : Colonic transplantation results in recurrent pyelonephritis and hyperchloremic acidosis. Option D : Ileal conduit is not a recommended procedure for ureterovaginal fistula.

questions.text: A 24-year-old woman postpartum day 3 has a chief complaint of continuous dribbling of urine and can't pass urine normally. What is the diagnosis and when will you repair it?
questions.correct_answer: B. Vesicovaginal fistula and after 6 weeks
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Vesicovaginal fistula and after 6 weeks

Highyeild:

The most common cause in developing countries is obstructed labor. Presents after 7-10 days. There is continuous leakage of urine and no normal voiding. Test for diagnosis: 3 swab tests. Repair at 3 months if following obstructed labor. Surgery of choice: Latzko

Extraedge:

Avoid intercourse for at least 3 months. Avoid pregnancy for at least 12 months.

questions.text: A 65-year-old postmenopausal woman was undergoing surgery for endometrial carcinoma. The surgery was a total radical hysterectomy with bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy. The uterus was removed successfully, but while removing the ovary the surgeon accidentally nicks one structure lying immediately behind the ovary. What should be the next step to be performed by the surgeon?

options.label: A
options.text: Clamp the artery, which is bleeding.

options.label: B
options.text: Start suction of peritoneal cavity, after giving peritoneal wash and repair the leaking structure.

options.label: C
options.text: The surgeon should continue his dissection as it doesn’t need intervention.

questions.correct_answer: C. The surgeon should continue his dissection as it doesn’t need intervention.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

The surgeon should continue his dissection as it doesn’t need intervention. The structure immediately behind is the ureter and so the patient's perineum will start filling with urine the correct answer.

questions.text: Postpartum VVF is best repaired after:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

3 months Management of VVF is surgical management.

Highyeild:

Timing of surgery: Small urinary fistulas sometimes heal spontaneously during the first few weeks. However, in the case of an established fistula – it is better to wait for about 3 months for all tissue inflammation to subside. If one attempt fails to heal the fistula, the second attempt is done after 3 months. In fistulas following surgery, the waiting period is 3–6 months. In fistulas following radiation: 6 months – 2 years time can be taken before inflammation subsides.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options A, B, and D are false.

Extraedge:

Avoid intercourse for at least 3 months. Avoid pregnancy for at least 12 months.

questions.text: A multipara female with a history of LSCS a month ago, presents with cyclical hematuria.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

UVF The condition of cyclical passage of menstrual blood in urine is called memoria.

Highyeild:

Menouria is seen in ureterovesical fistulae. Usually follows cesarean section. The patient complains of hematuria/passage of menstrual discharge via the urethra at the time of menstruation. The patient does not have urinary incontinence. Menouria is seen when the ureterovesical fistula opens into the uterus above the isthmus. The presence of the fistula can be demonstrated by hysterography (but not by cystography) and cystoscopy. Treatment is by abdominal repair.

Extraedge:

Another important cause of cyclical hematuria is endometriosis of the bladder.
